sentences.english: The Death Star was to be an instrument of terror, meant to cow treasonous worlds with the threat of annihilation.
sentences.chinese: 死星是恐怖的工具，用毀滅來恐嚇叛國的星球。

sentences.english: He was branded a traitor to his country.
sentences.chinese: 他被指責爲一個叛國者。

sentences.english: His speech was a treasonous one.
The loyal clone troopers executed their treasonous Jedi generals in cold blood.
sentences.chinese: 忠誠的克隆人士兵冷酷地處決了叛國的絕地將軍們。

sentences.english: Anybody who set himself up as king, without being appointed king by the Senate, that was itself an act of treason.
sentences.chinese: 任何人自稱爲王，而不受元老院冊封，那就是叛國罪。

sentences.english: Louis Riel, the leader of the Métis was hanged for treason in 1885 for his leading role in resisting the federal government.
sentences.chinese: 瑞爾，因帶頭試圖反抗聯邦政府以叛國的罪名被絞死。

sentences.english: If they failed in their endeavors, they would have been hanged as traitors .
sentences.chinese: 如果他們的努力失敗，他們會被當作叛國者絞死。

sentences.english: The punishment for treason is death.
sentences.chinese: 對叛國罪的處罰是處死。

sentences.english: In a society where truth becomes treason, then we're in big trouble.
sentences.chinese: 在一個真相反成叛國的社會，我們會有大麻煩。

sentences.english: Louis Riel, the leader of the Metis was hanged for treason in 1885 for his leading role in resisting the federal government.
sentences.chinese: 瑞爾，因帶頭試圖反抗聯邦政府以叛國的罪名被絞死。

sentences.english: The couple were tried for treason.
sentences.chinese: 這對夫婦因叛國罪受審。

sentences.english: Neo-liberalism brought to Turkiye nothing but lack of solidarity, exploitation of religious beleifs, encouraging seperatists and neverending freedoms for traitors.
sentences.chinese: 新自由主義給土耳其並沒有帶來什麼，只有叛國賊。
異議人士按叛國罪論處。

sentences.english: Absolutely loyal to the Republic, Cody believed that the Jedi were conspiring against the Republic.
sentences.chinese: 對共和國無限忠誠的科迪相信絕地密謀叛國。

sentences.english: Her enemies were accusing her of treason.
sentences.chinese: 她的敵人們控訴她犯下叛國罪。

sentences.english: All were found guilty of high treason.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都被裁定犯有叛國罪。

definition: strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to speak for sb/to intercede for sb/to lobby illegally
